title: Cheating on my FWB: is that possible? - m4w
text:
So I've been FWB with this woman for a few years. We met online and she made it clear she didn't want a long term relationship, she had just gotten out of her marriage and was just looking for friends to do things with. After a few platonic dates, I went over to her house one night and suddenly it was 3 am and her shirt was unbuttoned. 

We decided that we had been having a pretty good time together, and the night on the couch hinted at some additional possibilities. She allowed as how she might be interested in a FWB kind of relationship, nothing serious or permanent. In fact, she was planning on moving once her kids were out of school, and I was not in a position to do the same. All in all, my own situation was such that this FWB thing seemed like a good idea. 

And now it's three years later and we're still FWB. But... our definition seems to be different. She's content with seeing me once or twice a month, between her job and her kids, she just doesn't have time for more. I, on the other hand, well, you know. And yet she expects this to be an exclusive arrangement. This sort of sounds like a lot of marriages, does't it. LMAO. 

I've never seen the word 'exclusive' used in any definition of FWB, yet at the same time, I'm having trouble cheating on her. I DID see a couple of other women early on in our relationship, but just a bit, and nothing more than a bit of fooling around. And even that stopped a while ago. 

I'm posting out of town, so this is completely anonymous. We can talk completely freely. 

Thoughts?
